findings.title: Misleading Skill Description - External Tool Masquerading as Agent Skill
findings.description: The skill presents itself as an agent skill package but actually describes an external npm package ('npx ai-landing'). The SKILL.md contains no agent instructions, only documentation for a separate command-line tool. This is deceptive because users expect agent skills to provide instructions the agent follows, not documentation for external tools. The skill cannot function as described since it requires 'npx' execution and OPENAI_API_KEY, which are not part of the agent skill framework.
findings.snippet: Quick Start section shows 'npx ai-landing' commands, Requirements mention 'Node.js 18+' and 'OPENAI_API_KEY required', but no agent instructions are provided for how the agent should use this skill.
findings.remediation: Either: (1) Rewrite as a proper agent skill with instructions for the agent to generate landing pages directly, or (2) Clearly state in the description that this is documentation for an external tool, not a functional agent skill. Add proper agent instructions if intended as a skill.

metadata.overall_assessment: This skill package has significant structural issues. It appears to be documentation for an external npm package ('ai-landing') rather than a functional agent skill. The package lacks agent instructions, references a missing script file (description.py), and has incomplete manifest metadata. While no active malicious behavior is detected (no data exfiltration, command injection, or prompt injection), the misleading presentation and broken dependencies create moderate security and functionality concerns. The skill cannot function as described and may confuse users about its actual capabilities. Primary issues are deceptive packaging (presenting external tool docs as an agent skill) and missing dependencies.
metadata.meta_confidence_reason: The entire SKILL.md is clearly npm package documentation with zero agent instructions. This is objectively verifiable by reading the content.
metadata.meta_exploitability: N/A - Not a security exploit, but functional misrepresentation
metadata.meta_impact: Medium - Users cannot use this skill as intended, creates confusion about skill capabilities

findings.title: Missing Referenced Script File
findings.description: The skill references 'description.py' in its instructions but this file is not included in the skill package. This creates a broken dependency that prevents the skill from functioning. If description.py was intended to contain malicious code, its absence prevents detection. If it's a legitimate component, the skill is incomplete and non-functional.
findings.snippet: Referenced Files section shows 'description.py (not found)'. The file is mentioned but not provided in the package.
findings.remediation: Include the description.py file in the skill package if it's required for functionality. If the reference is erroneous, remove it from the documentation. Ensure all referenced files are present and their purpose is clearly documented.

metadata.overall_assessment: This skill package has significant structural issues. It appears to be documentation for an external npm package ('ai-landing') rather than a functional agent skill. The package lacks agent instructions, references a missing script file (description.py), and has incomplete manifest metadata. While no active malicious behavior is detected (no data exfiltration, command injection, or prompt injection), the misleading presentation and broken dependencies create moderate security and functionality concerns. The skill cannot function as described and may confuse users about its actual capabilities. Primary issues are deceptive packaging (presenting external tool docs as an agent skill) and missing dependencies.
metadata.meta_confidence_reason: The file is referenced but given the skill's nature (npm tool docs), it's unclear if this was ever meant to be functional or is just stale metadata
metadata.meta_exploitability: None - Missing file prevents any execution
metadata.meta_impact: Low - Skill is already non-functional due to lack of agent instructions
